author: Pablo Halpern
comment: My 1st generation Pixel has a wimpy vibration, so I often missed the first notification. By repeating the vibration and vibrating for longer, this app has prevented me from missing important messages.
Doesnt increase vibration times or strength

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: Please send me a mail if you need support. The app never claimed to increase your vibration times or strength. Please read the app description on what the app does

author: Brad C
comment: Very simple and works great. Couldn't ask for more.

author: susmitha ghadai
comment: great aap

author: Cody Smacker
comment: Such a life saver! Problems with getting notifications on my Sony Xperia e5 and this app works around it. Would give five stars if it offered instant notification beeps

author: Lori Mulhisen
comment: Awesome app.  This feature should be part of stock Android and  I can't live without this app.  I was missing notifications after moving from a Moto X which had a great feature called Active Display.  My new Moto E has a watered down version of Active Display so this app has solved my problem of missed notifications.  Thank you!!

author: G S
comment: It's good.  The only thing i cant work out is that it still vibrates even after I've dismissed and read the notification.  Would be good if this could be fixed.  Have Moto g4

author: Remmie M
comment: So Uhm.. I like it but I haven't gotten a single vibration yet on my android wear device.. even though my friend I had spam my skype with the message "hi" over and over again. Skype created the notifications in the bar and I selected to add it manually..  I had other notification intercept things running but disabled all of them including android wear's own stock application. The only application with notification access now is this one and even with doing all that and resetting my smart watch and having skype spammed (my phone is on vibrate only) and I have the "send to android wear device only" checkbox checked, I still get nothing. I really like the design I just wish it DID something. This is probably a rare case as My device is actually a samsung gear S2 or whatever flashed from Tizen to Android Wear ...

author: David MacMillan
comment: Allows me to program my reminders to vibrate every minute until I turn it off so that I dont miss something important that needs to be done. Life saver.
Doesn't work. S5, android 6.0.1

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: The app works fine on the Galaxy S5

author: Tony Milczarek
comment: I love the concept, but I can't get it to work on my ZTE axiom and my Garmin vivo hr. Any idea? I have everything I want it to do checked.

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: Hey, I dont think that Garmin device runs Android, does it?

comment: Just what I needed. No BS.

author: Naim Rached
comment: Great app i like it !

author: John Moses Ventura
comment: i bought the paid version for android wear and to my disappointment it's not working on my Huawei watch.. i've got the developer preview for android wear it could be the issue but i don't think so it should cost that much of a difference since it is just a command handled by phone to revibrate the watch.. so disappointed.. *reply >yes i am aware of that but could that change the disappointment since of all the apps i installed for my watch only yours doesn't work.if the preview comes out tommorow?? what?

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: The Android Wear feature works perfectly fine with the officially release Android Wear version. I have no idea if it works with a dev preview of an upcoming release. You should be aware of that if you install a preview release... If Android 2.0 is release, the app will work on that (it most definitly already works on the preview...)

title: disappointed

author: All My World
comment: Somehow lost notification setting in Sounds with Marshmallow and Nougat.  Very frustrating not to have vibration for calls and messages!  Thank you for a simple app that gets there job done.  Now I know when I am receiving calls and messages again.
title: For Huawei Nexus 6P

author: karen mario
comment: Wrote a review earlier would like to change as when I purchased the app accidentally wrote down a wrong code.  The purchase on my visa didnt go through which caused the app not to work. Sorry for the inconvenience.  Great app !!! Al so, received  a quick reply back from the developer when I had a problem with the app...nice to know someone helps with problems!!

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: Please send me a mail if you need support

author: Jonathan Tanihardjo
comment: I am a new android wear user. I was so desperate trying to find a solution to incoming call notifications in my android wear. When I first tried the paid version, it let me down. I thought i bought the app for nothing. I didn't get the notif in the watch. The next day, when I thought the app was no good, an incoming call notif finally appeared in my watch. I was really surprised. It seems the app is finally working after I restart the watch.
title: The app works fine with moto 360 2nd gen

author: Gage Peterson
comment: This does exactly what it's supposed to very well. However I do wish I could filter by person texting me.
Fantastic program, works well, reliable. Only wish it could vibrate 2x, 3x each time (buzz, buzz instead of just buzz) because an single vibrate sometimes isn't enough to be noticed.

author: Andrew Damon
comment: This app is fantastic and solves the weak vibration problem in my Huawei Honor 8. Now I don't care if I miss the initial weak vibration. This app will buzz the hell out of me a few seconds later.

author: Thanit Siripakarn
comment: Would it be nice to be able to change vibration intensity and its pattern? Nexus 6p has vibration so weak.

author: Matt Thomas
comment: Works as it should do! my new phone don't let you change the vibration but this app helps me as I set it for 5 seconds and its enough for me to know iv'e got a text or call. I'm a bit deaf so it helps a lot. Only thing I would like to change about the app is to have it done in seconds and not milliseconds as it would be easier to use. But Great app so far

author: Narissa Hill
comment: I have mixed feelings about this app.  I feel like the free app app is deceptive. If you want to actually use it to change the vibrations on your watch you have to purchase it. I uninstalled the free app immediately and downloaded "Feel The Wear" where a number of their functions are free. However, Feel The Wear felt like it weakened the strength of the vibration on my Moto 360. (The problem I'm trying to solve.)  So I came back and decided to buy this app.  It's very simple, easy to use and straightforward.  It doesn't intensify the vibration (but I don't think anything can).  And the feature to keep notifying you until you respond is perfect.  For a buck that's not bad.

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: You should have just read the app description before downloading the app...

author: karissa walaszek
comment: I notice the app says that if my phone is on silent it won't vibrate on my watch, it says that on the main screen. But when I click on the settings it has a setting for it to vibrate on the watch even when the phone is on silent. It won't vibrate on my watch when the phone is on silent though but I need it to. I just paid for this app and it wont even work for what it says it will.

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: Please send me a mail if you need support

title: Won't work when phone is set to silent

author: John Fabrega
comment: I love the fact that I get repeating notifications on my Android Wear Smartwatch. Engaged and active developer. One of my favorite apps. Would be even better if it could also push repeating notifications to my Ditto.

author: Paul Hyles
comment: Finally found a call sms and application app that works on my new motto android 6. Keep up the good work 1 suggestion would be adding a better description for searching missed reminder call sms apps
title: This is simple and works
